description: The round payoff this round was 3. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -3000.

The game is structured so that both players’ actions have strong interaction effects – while choosing option 2 can yield a positive payoff if the opponent sticks with the default option, it carries an extremely high risk (a very large negative payoff) if both choose option

The outcome on 2024-01-02, where the round input was 3, resulted in John suffering a large negative payoff of –3000. This illustrates that if both players opt for option 2, even a modest round input quickly becomes dangerous, implying that coordination or predicting the other’s deviation from defaults is crucial.

Implicit in this scenario is a strategic tension: while there is an opportunity to secure a high payoff by deviating when the opponent sticks to option 1, mutual deviation is costly. Thus, the game rewards those who can reliably predict or induce the opponent’s behavior.
